before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"e7feh","text":"Sample Collection and Preparation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e36qp","text":"Aseptically collect venous blood from the antecubital vein of the forearm and dispense it into either a serum separator tube (SST), a plain tube (red top), or an EDTA tube (plasma).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dl29c","text":"Centrifuge the specimen at 3500 rpm for 10 minutes and transfer the serum or plasma into a sterile plain tube or a cryovial.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8psqh","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rbn7","text":"NB:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brfgf","text":"For samples collected into SST or plain tubes, allow the specimen to stand vertically undisturbed for at least 1 hour for the specimen to clot completely before centrifuging it to yield serum","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6c4ns","text":"Samples collected into EDTA tubes can be centrifuged immediately to yield plasma.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dadcj","text":"Care should be taken during sample collection and processing to avoid haemolysis of the specimen","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9j04v","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8it9r","text":"Handling of PCR Reagents","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27fee","text":"Allow the PCR Master Mix and the other components of the Bosphore HBV Quantification kit to thaw completely at 4°C before use and avoid centrifuging to thaw.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"db71d","text":"With over 400 million HBV infections, viral hepatitis B remains a global public health concern. Diagnosis is primarily based on an immunological assay approach, which utilizes the Hepatitis B surface antigen in detection amongst other markers. This method, however, has several limitations which include the inability to detect mutation in the viral genome resulting in diagnostic escape and low antigen titers in study samples. Using an alternative approach, which is the molecular diagnostic technique such as real-time polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) would circumvent the limitations of immune detection. This protocol, thus, provides a step-by-step process of HBV diagnosis using RT-PCR which is a sensitive tool for diagnosis. The steps involved include sample collection and preparation, nuclei acid isolation, HBV detection and quantification using RT-PCR as well as the interpretation of results.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"en0ea","text":"This protocol combines the high nuclei acid yield from isolation using Zymo Quick DNA Mini-prep Kit and Bosphore HBV Quantitative Kit for amplification of HBV DNA. The Bosphore HBV Quantitative Kit has a low detection limit of 1×101 IU/ml and with a turn-around time of less than 4 hours when combined with Zymo Quick DNA Mini-prep Kit. The nucleic acid isolated in this protocol can be amplified using the Bosphore HBV Quantitative kit on several thermocyclers, which makes the protocol robust, cost-efficient, and cost-effective in resource-scarce areas.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":231,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"6e4lj","text":"This is an optimized protocol for the quantitative detection of Hepatitis B using Zymo Quick-DNA Miniprep Kit (200 prep) and Bosphore HBV Quantitative Kit. The authors do not accept any liability for the collection and handling of both samples and reagents, results from the use of the protocol and its interpretation as well as any errors or omissions that may be made. The reader should make his/her own evaluation as to the appropriateness of the procedures described.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

D154B210DAE811EDB4E1C9B38654AB8F.name: serum/plasma
D154B210DAE811EDB4E1C9B38654AB8F.description: serum is obtained after centrifuging venous blood collected into an anticoagulant-free tube and allowed to clot completely. Plasma is obtained after centrifuging venous blood collected into anticoagulated tube, preferably EDTA

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

{"blocks":[{"key":"85rph","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cb6b1","text":"Samples that cross the threshold in the FAM channel are displayed with their starting quantities and the corresponding Ct-values. Samples that do not cross the threshold are displayed as “No Ct” or “ –”","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djtic","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ps7j","text":"Possible outcomes from the PCR:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dagmb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"19kpm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0":{"0":"D"},"1":{"0":"_"},"2":{"0":"3"},"D_1":{"className":"_dt-h-justify"},"D_3":{"className":"_dt-h-justify"}},"colTitles":["","","",""],"colWidths":["75","75","114","328"],"data":[["+","-","HBV Positive","The sample contains a high viral load of HBV and may suppress the amplification of the Internal Control. No need to check the HEX"],["+","+","HBV Positive","The sample contains HBV Nucleic acid"],["+","-","HBV Positive*","Caution: If the sample has a viral load \u003c10 IU/ml and no Internal Control amplification, it indicates PCR inhibition which requires assay repetition (see troubleshooting)"],["-","+","HBV Negative","No HBV Nucleic acid was detected. Internal control amplified indicating good DNA isolation and PCR procedures. "],["-","-","Invalid**","Repeat the assay (see troubleshooting)"]],"guid":"33289EE0DAFB11EDA79F1923EEF9163E","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"13r15","text":"* and **: refer to the troubleshooting section ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["+","-","HBV Positive","The sample contains a high viral load of HBV and may suppress the amplification of the Internal Control. No need to check the HEX"],["+","+","HBV Positive","The sample contains HBV Nucleic acid"],["+","-","HBV Positive*","Caution: If the sample has a viral load \u003c10 IU/ml and no Internal Control amplification, it indicates PCR inhibition which requires assay repetition (see troubleshooting)"],["-","+","HBV Negative","No HBV Nucleic acid was detected. Internal control amplified indicating good DNA isolation and PCR procedures. "],["-","-","Invalid**","Repeat the assay (see troubleshooting)"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1hm6e","text":"Initiate the protocol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e4n7j","text":"*If the sample has a viral load   and no Internal Control amplification, it requires that the assay is repeated once. Freeze-thaw[freeze the sample (temperature ≤ -10°C) for 20 minutes and defrost at room temperature for 10 minutes]  the nucleic acid sample and dilute it with nuclease-free water in a ratio of 1:2. Use the diluted nucleic acid for repeating the assay","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":32,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fgioa","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kf3v","text":"** Repeat the assay once taking into consideration possible pipetting errors in the first assay.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"44e","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brs6k","text":"If both repeat as indicated above fail to yield the expected/better results, a new specimen should be collected from the patient and the process from nucleic acid isolation to amplification should be repeated with the new sample.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mobd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fidpb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"\u003c10","error_concentration":true,"guid":"9B56E390DAFC11EDA79F1923EEF9163E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2495}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"49fnf","text":"Add   of β-mercaptoethanol to   of Genomic Lysis Buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":30,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9ijhi","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2nuv8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fil48","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"D8CE35C0DAFC11EDA79F1923EEF9163E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"598F69C0DAFF11EDA79F1923EEF9163E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3rthu","text":"Cap the bottle tightly after each use","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e39vu","text":"Identify unknown samples (test samples), standards, positive control, and negative control on the plate as described below. Assign the right quantitative values to the standards","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7mr88","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e3lpk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"well_plate_map","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"guid":"5DFBC660E21711ED88E01B3BF51DD780","id":0,"well":[["Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Negative Control"],["Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown",""],["Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Standard 1"],["Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Standard 2"],["Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Standard 3"],["Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Standard 4"],["Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown",""],["Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","Unknown","   Positive   Control"]]}}}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"5vkqb","text":"1. Handle all blood specimens and reagents as a potential biohazard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5sd9","text":"2. Discard all waste materials in the appropriate receptacles. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1450m","text":"3. β-mercaptoethanol has a pungent smell, it should be opened in a well-aerated space.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5fi3d","text":"4. Ensure the use of the appropriate PPEs at all times","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
